thread.title: In Transit: Seneca Art and Culture Center to Open in October
thread.title_full: In Transit: Seneca Art and Culture Center to Open in October

author: DIANE DANIEL
title: In Transit: Seneca Art and Culture Center to Open in October
text: Seneca Art and Culture Center to Open in October SEPT. 5, 2015 Continue reading the main story Seneca Center The Seneca Art and Culture Center opens Oct. 3 at Ganondagan State Historic Site in Victor, N.Y., 20 miles southeast of Rochester . The center is built on the site of the original Seneca settlement, destroyed in 1687. The gallery will offer changing exhibitions conveying the story of the Seneca and Haudenosaunee (also known as Iroquois) people through centuries of artistic and historical artifacts and will also include work from contemporary Native American artists. See More » The new center, at 17,300 square feet, was designed to fit into the natural landscape. Built into the side of a hill adjacent to the site’s replica longhouse, its exterior mimics the structure through the use of simulated bark siding materials, clean horizontal lines and earth-tone colors. Outside, gardens will incorporate traditional Seneca and Haudenosaunee plants. A version of this article appears in print on September 6, 2015, on page TR3 of the New York edition with the headline: On the Horizon. Order Reprints | Today's Paper | Subscribe Loading...
